node.title: Victorian Opposition Leader says 2022 election is winnable due to 'arrogance' of Daniel Andrews
node.alt: A close-up photograph of Victorian Opposition Leader Matthew Guy speaking to media.
node.description: In a speech to the Liberal Party State Council, Matthew Guy unveils a $2.5 billion plan to boost manufacturing and says he wants his party to be aÂ "contrast to the nastiness, the arrogance of our opponents".
node.content:
["Victorian Opposition Leader Matthew Guy has unveiled a $2.5 billion plan to boost manufacturing in the state and pledged lockdowns would be a thing of the past if his party is elected to government.", "In a speech to the Liberal Party State Council, Mr Guy told colleagues the 2022 election was winnable\u00a0because Victorians were disillusioned with the current government and \"arrogant\" Premier Daniel Andrews.", "The annual council meeting comes just under 12 months before the next state election \u2014 a vote which most major polls suggest Labor will win in a landslide.", "But Mr Guy, who has been back in the top job since\u00a0rolling Michael O'Brien in September, used his speech to rally Liberal Party members to \"get active now\".", "\"We've got 12 months. It's a big job ahead of us,\" Mr Guy said.", "He said there should be \"no more talk, no more keyboard warriors\" and urged members to provide an alternative to the incumbent Labor government.", "", "
State political reporter Bridget Rollason breaks down the seats that could decide the next election.
", "The $2.5 billion Rebuilding Jobs, Bringing Manufacturing Home\u00a0program announced on Sunday\u00a0was aimed at making Victoria the \"engine room of Australian manufacturing\", Mr Guy said. The money would be allocated over five years.", "It will focus on priority areas such as health, clean energy, food, mineral processing, defence, transport and \"digital transformation\".", "There would be $1 billion specifically allocated to regional Victoria if the Coalition was elected.", "An additional pledge would\u00a0create a\u00a0$400 million infectious diseases response centre\u00a0with\u00a0100 beds, 300 specialist\u00a0nurses and\u00a0PPE sourced and made in Australia.", "Speaking to reporters outside of the conference, Mr Guy said it was not yet clear how many jobs the manufacturing plan would create, but that a taskforce would be set up to oversee it.", "He said the focus would be on creating careers, not just jobs.", "Victoria was once a manufacturing hub, but the closure of car factories and other economic shifts have seen the industry shrink over recent decades.", "
'No more lockdowns' under Coalition government, Guy says
", "Labor's legacy of two years of lockdowns \u2014 a move many health experts say saved countless lives \u2014 was a key feature of speeches at the council.", "Federal Treasurer Josh Frydenberg addressed the room, saying Melbourne's move from the world's most liveable city to the most locked-down city \"is a reminder of why we need good government\".", "Mr Guy took aim at the worsening mental health crisis, ballooning hospital waitlists, the unemployment rate, the state's record debt and over-spending on the government's infrastructure projects.", "Mr Guy mentioned his opponent, Mr Andrews, by name, saying the \"out of touch and arrogant\" Premier was the reason the election was winnable for the Coalition.", "Mr Andrews has been a polarising figure throughout the pandemic but has maintained widespread public support, even as his popularity waned during lockdowns.", "Mr Guy said his party needed to be the \"contrast to the nastiness, the arrogance of our opponents\".", "Mr Guy has pushed a message of positivity since becoming Opposition Leader again, a marked difference from the focus on crime and \"African gangs\" that was overwhelmingly panned by voters in 2018.", "To applause from the crowd, he reiterated a promise that\u00a0\"under a Coalition government, there will be no more lockdowns.\"", "He also pledged to rip up the\u00a0contentious Public Health and Wellbeing Amendment (Pandemic Management) Bill 2021 if elected next year.", "The Opposition voted against the bill, which passed through Parliament last week after being heavily amended to appease crossbench concerns about accountability and transparency.", "\"[The bill] is not just unreasonable, it's wrong,\" Mr Guy said.", "Included on the agenda of the 168th state council was a federal motion about defunding the ABC, an organisational motion to oppose gender quotas\u00a0and state motions about abolishing payroll tax.", "An\u00a0internal administrative motion from state party president Robert Clark to postpone internal administrative committee elections from 2022 to 2023 was rejected.", "Mr Clark was re-elected to the role later in the afternoon.", "The meeting ran all day Sunday and included\u00a0internal party elections and hours of debate on about 100 motions.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
